comment: I took him for Principles of Nutrition. He accused me and other students of cheating so be VERY careful, as he's strict. That aside, I would have gotten an A if I knew to only study the weekly assignments for exams at the start of the semester. If you do that then you're guaranteed to pass all the exams. Overall, he was fine though.
Material isn't too helpful with test. A bit strict on things. Would not recommend.

tests were extremely difficult and often felt disconnected from the material covered in class. Despite studying, the questions were confusing and overly specific. The class offered little opportunity to improve your grade, and the work felt like filler. Would not recommend this course.

Took this class for the nutrition minor, but it was a huge letdown and I am now switching becasue of him. Professor Conrad tries to be relatable as a KSU grad but is overly harsh. The work felt like busy work, and the few major assignments were graded unfairly. Would not recommend this class at all.
